Reviews.Title: “It is a Residence Inn but.....”
Reviews.Author: BPub1
Reviews.Content: As one who frequents these Marriott properties I've become accustom (spoiled) to nicer hotel rooms. This property is old and looks it; Marriott simply needs to scrap it and build a new one. There is no shortage of nice hotels in the Branson area and I’m not sure how this one competes other than by patrons that use their hotel rewards like me. At approx. $160 per night you can do much better. The carpet, walls, interior all scream to be replaced. The breakfast area is almost like a hallway and lines were long both mornings. The rooms do have newer HD flat screens and appliances (at least the one I stayed in did), but the rest of the property reminds me of an old lake lodge. The thing that makes this place tolerable is the wonderful staff that they have working there! Everyone from Neill, the General Manager, to the kitchen staff were incredibly helpful, sincere, and just all around nice!! Marriott - rebuild, keep your employees, and make your patrons happy!

Reviews.Title: “Don't get some of these reviews.”
Reviews.Author: weBroadtrippin
Reviews.Content: I guess everyone expects hotels to stay brand new 100% of the time. Yes, some furniture is worn, abut that's a given being in the high traffic area it is in. The preventative Maintenence did seem a little absent (i.e. pool area and hallway carpets and wallpaper). A suggestion for the hallways may be wooden trim that match the height of the housekeeping carts. After staying in many and working for Marriott myself, this place did not seem to be what I was expecting based on some of the reviews I saw on here. Although a little worn, this place was very clean and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: KClady1957
Reviews.Content: I had read the reviews advising of the need of remodeling. This is true. The hallways are scuffed a bit from luggage carts, the furniture in our room was a bit worn. That said, the room was super clean. The scuff marks didn't bother us a bit. The staff are so amazingly friendly. The breakfast was wonderful, and they had my favorite cereal and Activa yogurt on hand each morning. The one night we were there for the evening reception, they had cheese, crackers, veggies, dips, etc. It was a nice snack to have if you are planning on a late dinner..which we were. I*'ve now stayed here twice, and have greatly enjoyed both times.

Reviews.Title: “Not your typical Marriott”
Reviews.Author: Kevin P
Reviews.Content: Don't be tempted to believe this is your usual Marriott. Other than the name above the door, it doesn't hold a candle to any other Marriott experience you may have enjoyed. At one time, it might have been but now it is very run down, pool area is tiny, rooms small and it attracts a rather unusual crowd. On a bright note, the free breakfast and evening social hour were not bad but get there early as it is jam packed. Don't let the name fool you here.

Reviews.Title: “We greatly enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: quizcook
Reviews.Content: We had opportunity to stay at the Residence Inn in Branson while attending a competition. We had a group of eight and had two rooms. Both rooms had bedrooms separated from the living and kitchen areas, which was wonderful! The suite kitchens were nicely stocked with the necessary dishes and cookware, which was nice. Our 2-bedroom suite also had a full-size refrigerator and stove. The free breakfast varied a little each day, but had waffles (with (real) butter, syrup, strawberries in strawberry syrup and whipped cream, peanut butter and honey available as toppings), scrambled eggs, pastries, cereal, biscuits and gravy, a meat (sausage or ham), oatmeal (already made and with walnuts, brown sugar, and cinnamon available for toppings), either a medley of sausage, sweet peppers, and diced potatoes, or hashbrown patties, apples, and bananas. There was the usual coffee, juice, and milk, hot cocoa mix. In the evenings, they had a little snacky sort of meal. The two evenings we went, they had hot dogs one day and nachos and frito pies the second. The ladies who worked the kitchen area were fabulous, friendly, very helpful, and kind, regardless of whether the crowd was large or small. In fact, all of the staff and housekeeping crew were wonderful. We enjoyed the basketball court and swimming pool. The free wifi went out due to a storm our next to last day, but the manager wasted no time in notifying as many people as he needed to come check things and work on them in order to get it back up and running. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Remodeling a must”
Reviews.Author: mARIANO G
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located near main attractions. The staff was friendly.Rooms need to be remodeled, although very clean. Room was spacious with separate room. Two tv sets. Kitchenette and sofa bed. Breakfast included in price.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of undisclosed $100 non-refundable pet deposit and low price guarantee!”
Reviews.Author: noelpreasoner
Reviews.Content: I detest third party reservation centers with their lack of disclosure of policies and fees and their no holds barred cancellation policies, so generally I will locate a hotel through them, but call the hotel directly to see if they will match. Marriott alledges a "look no further lowest price guarantee" when you call their reservation center. On a third party site, I found this room for $131; on the Marriott app, it was $159. I called to see if they would honor that price, but they told me I would have to book through hotel.com if I wanted that. Really? Also, they offer no government rate or AAA. Be aware that if you are traveling with pets, beware if their $100 non- refundable pet "deposit" which is really a fee. They claim that it's a sanitation charge to clean the room thoroughly so that guests who are allergic to dogs or cats won't break-out. However, the desk clerk was unable to explain the process for which I was shelling out $100 for a one- night stay. On their mobile app, it says they are pet friendly, but nothing at all is mentioned about the "deposit" until you arrive at the hotel, and then the clerk doesn't tell you it's non-refundable. You won't know thar until they give you a form to fill out which states this AFTER you give then your credit card. Plus, the mobile app states Marriott's cancellation policy is 24 hours in advance, so going someplace else with a reasonable per fee means forfeiting my $159. You are screwed either way. At least the room would be nice... NOT! It was jank all the way around. The parts that are easy to clean (sheets, duvet cover, tub, toilet, etc) were clean, but the carpet and furniture were stain and pretty worn. To top it off, a pre-teen baseball team were sprinting up and down the hall along with their lour talking coaches. I asked for the manager who was unavailable. They were supposed to have hI'm contact me, but I guess he can't be bothered.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: RandyG62
Reviews.Content: The entrance is not very inviting- a front desk and a huge refrigeration unit filled with drinks for sale. A desk with a computer in the hallway for guests to use. We were asked to sign a paper saying we would be responsible for any damage done to the room which makes me laugh as you will have a hard time finding anything in the room that did not have some damage!!! The furniture needed to be replaced!!!! The whole hotel needed to be redone as for as I am concerned! The hotel layout was poor. We were in the basement in the back of the hotel which was far from front desk. We had trouble closing window that was not completely closed when we arrived. The back entranced needed to be vaccumed badly. They had a great front desk clerk at night !! The ladies at breakfast were great,too!! Even as good as they were, it did not make up for a hotel that needed to be remodeled and work on cleaning issues!!1 We say never again will we stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Callen13
Reviews.Content: We travel more than a lot and mostly stay at Marriott properties. Marriott messed up our reservations and had to put us in this Residence Inn. Our room was not that clean and smelled. We opened the windows to air it out and the basketball court and outdoor patio was just below us. The first night we were there guest were allowed to play on the court until 10:00. At 7:40am the next morning the bouncing woke us and we had to call the front desk. We left for the day and came back to a party below our windows where the guests were loud and lots of drinking...and more basketball until 10:00 when they were supposed to leave the area. Unfortunately, the party went on until 11:15 because the poor girl at the front desk came out and told then twice that they had to leave. They refused so she called the police! The only saving grace were the two wonderful women at the front desk at night and in the morning. I will never stay there again. This was one of our worst experiences staying at a Residence Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stayed”
Reviews.Author: cmnr0912
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at the Residence Inn. We were please with our room, it was the perfect size for my husband and I.I do agree that maybe it could stand an updating, but it wasn't so bad that I considered it dirty or uncomfortable. The hotel was located in a convient location for driving, not walking, but that was fine for us. We will defineately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Kid Paradise”
Reviews.Author: jenfarra
Reviews.Content: My kids were just delighted with our stay here. They loved the small scale of the building that they could easily learn, our beautiful golf course view, our suite with a door so kids could go to bed before grownups, the fun pool and outdoor fire pit, our kitchen with popcorn to pop and wine glasses for our chocolate milk, the laundry room to dry our swimsuits, the breakfast with lots of kid-friendly options, the evening snacks, the super-friendly and accommodating staff - altogether a wonderful visit.

Reviews.Title: “Badly in need of refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: jlhcorley
Reviews.Content: I am glad that my weekend stay at the Residence Inn in Branson was paid for using Marriott points, because if I had spent my own money, I would have been very unhappy. The staff was friendly and the breakfast was adequate. The indoor pool was fun for the kids. However, the rooms were very worn. The leather was cracked and ripped on the living room furniture. The bed was extremely hard. I am not very picky about what mattresses I sleep on, but this one was uncomfortable. The room card claimed the regular charge for one night was $179, but this was definitely not a $179 experience. My husband and I have stayed at many Marriott hotels across the country for business and pleasure; this hotel does not live up our usual experience.

Reviews.Title: “Looks great...But it's just okay.”
Reviews.Author: tabatha1023
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night in April and it was great for the most part. The room looked really good overall. Minor scratches and tears in the furniture, but for our short stay we really didn't mind. The pool and whirlpool were fantastic and the hotel is in a great location! The fire pit was a nice touch and very relaxing. The staff was friendly. BUT The bed was absolutely awful! I couldnt sleep at all. It was hard as a rock. I probably would have been better off sleeping on the floor. Overall: I would love to go back. But until I hear that they've updated there beds...I'll be staying at a hotel right down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally Located, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: YogaTravel
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in July '11 the night before a half marathon. The hotel is centrally located right off of the main strip, but it's also a block from a street where you can take an easy shortcut through town to get to the other side. The hotel is impeccible and insanely clean! The gathering area is extremely spacious. There was a baseball tournament that weekend and although the hotel was filled with kids the room stayed quiet. There's a great outdoor basketball court and an area for grilling. The check in has all types of bottled drinks and snacks. The mini kitchen was fantastic to store all of our drinks and snacks! The only downside was that the bathroom was only accessible through the bedroom, so if someone is using the foldaway then OT can be a bit awkward. All in all, I'd stay here again in a heartbeat! Also, for families there is a fun mini golf course that you can walk to and is right down the block.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: Twilight54
Reviews.Content: My daughter, granddaughter and I stayed here for spring break. We stayed in a suite, that was very reasonably priced. It is a very quiet area, off the main strip. We went in the spring, which is slow in Branson, but we got to see several shows. The folks there at the motel were very helpful at getting us tickets, at a slightly lower price. The breakfast if very minimal and there is a short time that they serve. But I would stay again, for the price it is well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to expected Residence Inn standards”
Reviews.Author: zimaaaaah
Reviews.Content: Room was smaller than expected for a 1 bedroom. Tried to pay to upgrade to a 2 bedroom but was told general manager doesn't allow that if you are using points. Hmmm.. Ok. Guess we will take the 1 bedroom. Room felt very dated, although it was mostly clean. There were 2 carpet stains and I also saw the moldy corners that other reviewers have mentioned. The bed was really not comfortable at all. Seemed like there was no padding on top of the mattress. The sofa bed was really old looking; some of the springs on the bottom were showing thru the material. Can't comment on breakfast went out instead. On the bright side, the pool and hot tub were in good shape and the fire pit was a nice item to have available. As I mentioned, we were using a free night certificate, but if I had paid the amount listed on the website I would have not been happy. There are much better places for pretty much the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Carl_Shea
Reviews.Content: I and my family have stayed here 3 times. We love Branson during Christmas, but have also visited in the fall. This hotel features one & two bedroom suites, more like a small apartment. I am a Marriott Platinum member and travel a lot for business (usually 100+ nights a year at Marriott nationally) and I would rate this as average, but not bad. The last stay the rooms were showing a little ear and tear, but I am sure we are getting close to the typical nationwide renovation that Marriott requires. The staff are friendly and breakfast is typical. Centrally located and easy access to all of the shows.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bittingerdenise
Reviews.Content: This hotel was so clean and helpful. The staff were all so nice and just an overall experience. Great breakfast burritos in the mornings. The fireplace was a great bonus and so was the outside fire-pit (it is on a timer which is by the door).

Reviews.Title: “Better Than Some Recent Reviews”
Reviews.Author: nativetexan01
Reviews.Content: I had read some less-than-flattering reviews re: Residence Inn-Branson. We had an excellent experience!! We traveled to Branson, celebrating 35th Wedding Anniversary. I had planned this trip for at least 6 months, & everything had to be perfect. Our 2nd floor, 1 bedroom suite was immaculate & spacious. Bed was great,shower was heavenly, and dressing area was roomy, and breakfast was very good(I had 3 different hot breakfasts during our stay. Personnel throughout the hotel were attentive, pleasant, and dedicated to serving all guests. We saw or experienced NOTHING anyone could consider negative. IT WAS GREAT!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good and bad....”
Reviews.Author: kac1eac2
Reviews.Content: We travel a lot, and stay at Residence Inn as often as possible. We stayed five nights in Branson. This hotel has some good points. Our room was very clean upon arrival. Since we had our two granddaughters with us, we did not use the housekeeping service every day, but the housekeeping ladies always very nicely provided the towels and other items we needed. The pool was warm and clean, as was the spa. The snacks served on weekday evenings were tasty. Now for the bad....The breakfast served at this Residence Inn was the worst we have ever had at any hotel chain. After the second morning, we started buying fresh pastries from a local Panera Bread and not even bothering with the slop that was being served. The elevators reek of smoke and do need to be cleaned up. One evening there was a group of young people around the fire pit that I'm fairly sure were not staying at the hotel. That was a little disconcerting. The beds are fairly hard and small. I have never had to give a Residence Inn just an average rating, but this one is just that. We will continue to stay at RI's, just not this one.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: Orion777
Reviews.Content: My husband wanted to take me on a fishing trip to the Branson area (which he has been visiting since he was a child). We spent our first two nights here at the Residence Inn. We have stayed at Marriotts before and this was a typical Residence Inn. They accept pets and everyone was extremely friendly. The reception desk even gave our pooch a complimentary dog biscuit. The property is nice. It was very quiet even though it was very full. It is a nice stroll to the grocery store and WalMart if you want to get out and walk. Its also very convenient to everything on the Strip without being actually on the Strip. I cannot comment on the breakfast bar because I did not go to breakfast but my husband brought me back eggs, biscuits, and sausage and said it was a regular breakfast bar with the usual, i.e. cereal, muffins, etc. I was there to rest and my husband was there to fish so I cannot comment on any of the shows, etc. We did order pizza one night and the Marriott recommends Pizza World. Never heard of them but they were delicious! One of the best pizzas I have had in a long time. I highly recommend them. All in all, our stay here before we moved to our location on the lake was very very pleasant. The place was clean and quiet and the rooms were exactly like their pictures. Also, on the day we were checking out, some steam cleaners were coming in to the building to do the drapes, carpets, etc. The staff does an excellent job maintaining this property so don't be bothered by some of the negative comments you might read. The staff members whom I encountered were always friendly and ready to please.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good Residence Inn”
Reviews.Author: ddandgma
Reviews.Content: This hotel is old and very dated. The bathroom had mold around the tub and large holes through the caulking. Furniture was shabby. The elevators were old, small, and slow. Definitely not a 5 Star Marriott!!

Reviews.Title: “NOT like other Residence Inns. Stay in Springfield instead.”
Reviews.Author: azcarrie
Reviews.Content: I'm surprised by the 4 star reviews! We stay at Marriott Residence Inn frequently, and this one is NOTHING like the rest! We stayed at the Residence Inn in Springfield for a night and it's just as we've come to expect....clean, beautiful, great breakfast including many healthy options, professional and friendly staff. The Branson location feels very old with "almost" remodeled rooms (furniture is still oak laminate and the tub/shower/lighting in bathroom seemed really old, but the walls and kitchen and bedding are nice, other than terrible pillows...bring your own!). The front desk area is full of clutter and cheap laminate cabinets and the front desk staff uniforms look more like outdated and falling apart housekeeping shirts. Come on people...buy some polo shirts or something, time to update. The dining area is OK. Plain, but OK. The housekeeping was good, typical of most Residence Inns. The pool is so much smaller than photos made it appear, and the tile and grout is in need of replacing, the pool area is very old and feels like a large laundry room. This was disappointing as our kids love to swim in hotel pools and even they said it was "yucky". The breakfast was cheap food and there were no healthy options. I was shocked that the only yogurt they offered was "trix" yogurt that was full of sugar and hot pink/neon yellow. The only fruit (other than canned fruit cocktail) were granny smith apples, no melon or bananas like other properties. Other properties also offer adult yogurt and granola, but not this one. Oh, and no hot chocolate packets or flavored coffee creamer either, just half and half. The breakfast staff person was VERY cranky every morning and we even heard other guests talking about how she woke up on the wrong side of the bed. The biscuits and gravy and the waffles are the only redeeming food at the breakfast, but they waste so many plastic cups by filling them with batter and putting lids on, only to be thrown away. Other properties have a batter dispenser and a cup to fill over and over so there is no waste. Other than being a very cheesy, outdated (other than previously mentioned updates) rendition of Marriott residence Inn, the very most shocking part of our stay was having our breakfast interrupted every single morning by people trying to sell us show tickets. I'm not kidding, they come right to your table as you're eating and try to sell you tickets, and it's a very hard sell! One was a magician selling his own show, another was a guy selling some morning show and we said no thanks and he said the kids would love it and started acting out part of the show but our youngest just looked scared of this weird guy and our teenager said "Awkward!" After he left. I can't believe this is allowed to go on, and I'll be letting the corporate offices know that nobody wants to be solicited. I doubt corporate even knows, the property managers probably just get a kickback on sales. It's just so Tacky. Anyhow, I rarely write reviews , and I think this may be my first on Yelp, but we were so disappointed and I wanted to warn other loyal MRI guests that this property is NOTHNG like you would expect. Everyone should do themselves a favor and stay at the Springfield location a half hour north. The extra drive into town will be well worth it for the upgrade in hotel experience. We will be staying in Springfield for our next Branson trip for sure! Silver Dollar City and White Water are favorites of ours, and well worth driving a half hour from a much better property:)

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing for a number of reasons”
Reviews.Author: bgaile
Reviews.Content: When we checked in (around 9pm) girl behind counter was on phone, mounds of laundry (linens) were piled up behind the desk.She was dressed in housekeeping type attire. She checked us in quickly though., It was a last minute trip but we were booked in to the bottom floor (literally the basement) Non smoking room smelled like smoke. Room was dark, dank. Carpet frayed where it met the tile. some kind of carpeted baseboards, real cheezy looking. Bath was small, only queen beds here because it's small. We paid $144 w/tax etc, felt like way overpriced for the condition/size of the room. Then we tried to go to bed but there was a radio alarm going off continuously in the room next to us. Finally at 12:15 am I called the desk and the lady said she would check it out. 45 minutes lateer it was still going off and when I called the desk back, she said she had come down and listened, but there was a guest checked into the room and she could disturb them! She did give us keys to another room on 3rd floor (which made me wonder why we were booked in the basement) and let us go sleep up there, which we did. Next morning we went down for breakfast (which did have a good variety, clean, etc.) Only complaint there was that the hostess would literally be in the middle of what you were preparing cleaning it up while you were trying to serve yourself. She did this everytime to the point that I had to say "excuse me." My sister and I were going to go for a swim after that and discovered a sign on the pool that said "closed until further notice." We went on with our other activities but if I had been there with kids for a few days that would have been totally unacceptalble. We usually stay at the Hampton Inn in north Branson, which we will go back to next trip to Branson. Didn't get a good feeling at this place at all, especially for the price!!

Reviews.Title: “Many hotels in Branson. This one is fine.”
Reviews.Author: fracmeister
Reviews.Content: Savvy family travelers love the Residence Inn for delivering clean suites, a good breakfast, decent service. No disappointments here. One of our 4 rooms wasn't unto snuff and they changed us out Drawbacks? Branson is crawling with family friendly hotels. You might wan to consider a package deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great place close to everything in Branson.”
Reviews.Author: BGDUDE
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because of the great reviews we read on Trip Advisor and the location. We could not have been more pleased with our decision. The location was within 5-10 minutes of all of Branson activities and most importantly Andy's Frozen custard shop! The hotel itself was quiet and mostly had older couples without children so it was quieter than some we have stayed at in Branson. The room was a 2 bedroom, which was a split bedroom plan which was perfect for 2 couples. It had a full kitchen and tvs in every room. The hotel staff were very polite and welcoming. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Residence Inn comes through again”
Reviews.Author: smilinggypsy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Residence Inn last week. It was as expected a nice experience. It had a nice kitchen area, it was very clean, had comfortable linens. Breakfast was awesome and the staff was friendly. The only minor consideration was they had an indoor pool and the water temp was a little too cool for comfortable use. Hot tub was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: Minnetonkalady
Reviews.Content: If you must be in Branson, this is a good choice. It is located in a quieter part of town, in a condo area, good or bad depending on your taste for sleaze. Branson Is pretty bad, but this hotel is nice. Suites are resonably roomy, seer I e is good and it is well furnished. Breakfast is provided and on weeknights an evening snack.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: angels622
Reviews.Content: My husband, son, daughter-in-law, grandaughter (7 weeks old), and myself spent two nights at this wonderful hotel. We had looked for something that was user friendly with a small infant. They promptly brought in a crib for the baby complete with bed linens. The rooms were spacious and comfortable. Loved having the small kitchenette complete with frig, stove-top, sink, and dishwasher. The breakfast was wonderful with both cold and hot foods available. They have evening snacks during weekdays too. I will definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: Zoe1209
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very clean and spacious. Beds, linens, and furniture were super comfortable! The staff was amazing and helpful. The free breakfast was some of the best I have ever had and the location was perfectly placed near the strip but still off enough to be quiet. They also had a very nice outdoor gas grill and gas firepit. The pool is heated and indoor. This hotel is highly recommended for anyone wanting a luxury stay at an economy price!!!

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect!”
Reviews.Author: nonny2tnj
Reviews.Content: First off this hotel is clean, does a great job catering to pet owners (be prepared to fork over a non refundable $100 for them to shampoo the carpets and furniture after you leave but I think it is worth it to have a pet friendly hotel) provides snacks you can buy in the lobby, a nightly meal, we had bbq sandwiches, chips, potato salad, macaroni salad, lettuce salad with dressings and brownie and rice krispie treat bites along with lemonade, or coffee. This is done Mon-Thur I believe, is free and changes daily. It has free high speed and wireless internet, plus a small business center with internet to use if you don't have a laptop with you. Connection was always terrifc with no problems. The staff is all friendly and helpful. It is located off the main drag, but not by far and is close to a Jubilee food market and Walmart if you need anything. It is also all suites and mini suites with full kitchens so you don't have to eat out the whole time if you don't want to. It is also very quiet and we saw several pet owners in the hotel while we were there, including a couple large dogs. Now for the down side. The indoor pool water on the first day was pretty cold so I never tried it again and the pictures indicate something far bigger than it is. It is VERY small, 3 feet at one end, 5 ft at the other. I found breakfast to be just ok at best. The scrambled eggs look and tasted like they were cartoned or powdered eggs, the sausage patties looked and tasted like dried out hockey pucks. I didn't have either the biscuits, gravy, waffles, cereal, yogurt, or muffins but did have a donut. It IS free however and offers something other than just a donut and juice for breakfast! I did find that our housekeeper fudged on vacuuming as my husband had eaten something with crushed almonds on it and some got on the carpet and when we came back to the room and the room had been cleaned the nuts were still in the same place on the floor, but I can certainly bend over and pick up a few nuts. They also have cheap plastic shower curtain liners that get mildewed on the bottom and no one had cleaned the one in our bathroom. Our housekeeper did provide daily extra towels for us, was always very pleasant, and overall the room was clean everyday. All in all, we will definitely stay here again and again. The few "cons" were not enough to be concerned about. I don't know why people book anywhere but with the hotel website. I have never gotten a better deal anywhere than booking directly with the hotel website.

Reviews.Title: “You can't go wrong here!”
Reviews.Author: Mychelle71
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay in Branson. No more than a few minutes from everything, depending on traffic. Front desk will direct you anywhere you need to go, even a laundromat, which they happen to have on the 2nd floor. Very clean and spacioius with larger than average bathtubs. Maid service exceptional. Free outstanding hot breakfast as well as free evening meal (barbque sandwiches, potato salad, baked beans). This is a great deal! Book with confidence :)

Reviews.Title: “clean, spacious and modern”
Reviews.Author: gydnew
Reviews.Content: We were passing through Branson for 1 night so I placed a $60 bid on a 3-star hotel. We were more than pleasantly surprised at our room at the Residence Inn. The hallway was kind of dark and dingy but the room was clean and spacious. It included a king sized bed, a pull-out couch and a kitchenette with appliances nicer than my apartment. This would have been the perfect room for an extended stay. It also included free wi-fi and a decent breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, beds are not TRUE Queens”
Reviews.Author: DelaineKcmo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, plus another couple stayed at the Residence Inn the weekend of July 10th. The hotel is very nice and clean. The staff was helpful and curteous. Breakfast in the morning was good and was well stocked. The only reason I'm giving this hotel a 4 instead of a 5 is because the bed felt more like a full size bed than a queen. Also, I would have to agree that the walls are thin and the people above us had kids and at one point we thought they were going to come through the ceiling.... Other than that, very happy with the hotel and would stay here again. It is very close to the 76 route strip. Great location for us.

Reviews.Title: “Stay with no worries”
Reviews.Author: mtabb
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed our stay at the Residence Inn by Marriott in Branson. Our room is clean and linens are fresh. We chose not to have housekeeping service on our first day and we received a letter stating to call the front desk if we needed anyting. We also received a letter from the general manager at the end of our stay asking for our feedback and thanking us. This is a place to stay if you want a clean room, free breakfast, computer availability with internet, laundry facility, relax in the pool, outside grill, etc. The Residence Inn truly made us feel right at home.

Reviews.Title: “Great facility in prime location”
Reviews.Author: SoonerDEW
Reviews.Content: Fifteen years ago, my then-new wife and I visited Branson for the first time and stayed at the Residence Inn. Our experience was great then, so we opted for our 2010 return visit (now with two near-teenagers and a grandmother in tow) to the same location. We weren't disappointed. My experience with Residence Inn properties has been varied over the years, but this facility was wonderful. We were able to book a two-bedroom suite capable of hosting five with kitchenette for $189/night barely two weeks before our arrival. Our room was clean, with fresh linens on the bed (you can't always assume that these days, even on a new check-in) and extra towels and pillows available per our reservation request. The only downside was that the fold-out sofabed was not large enough to accommodate both kids, necessitating a rollaway bed rental at an additional $15/night. That was the only disappointment in a room rated to sleep 6, but couldn't possibly do so in practical terms (and that's why the room rating is only 4/5). We were able to meet our assigned housekeeper, who went out of our way to meet our requests for towels, sheets, and other sundries. The location of this Residence Inn is on the east side of Wildwood Drive, perhaps a quarter-mile away from Branson's "main drag' (W 76 Country Blvd). Its central location is absolutely ideal for access to any of the area's main attractions. Although we didn't avail ourselves of it this trip, a public golf course is directly across the street, and clubs can be rented via the hotel's front desk. The only negatives during our stay were problematic keycard readers that made guest-only entry access a bit trying at times; as many as three keycards were needed to open the door. The keycard reader on the door to the room was slightly less troublesome; its possible the device that imprints the code on the keycards could be at issue. Additionally, the free breakfast buffet offered each morning was only marginal; the sausage patties looked strange, as if they'd been boiled, and the biscuits were microwaved - yet the scrambled eggs were good. The evening snack bar was a pleasant surprise with a variety of "snack-style" suppers available. For its consistency and prime location, we'd heartily recommend this Residence Inn and would return. Book early if at all possible, and recheck frequently to see if better rates come available as your vacation date approaches.

Reviews.Title: “BOOK THIS HOTEL ON PRICELINE.COM!”
Reviews.Author: joewathen
Reviews.Content: Priceline name your own price was 60/a night. way cheaper than the 140 advertised. We booked 2 rooms and both were GREAT. They upgraded one of the rooms to a 1 bedroom just so we could have rooms close to each other. Granite counter tops/stainless fridge and dishwasher. comfy beds/flat screen tv. everything was perfect. breakfast was buffet style w/ eggs, sausage, pancakes, cereal, fruit etc.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: HNAC
Reviews.Content: I recently spent several nights at the Branson Residence Inn. It was very conveniently located just off the Yellow Route, and across from the golf course. The one bedroom suite was very clean, comfortable, and tastefully decorated. I enjoyed the small indoor pool and hot tub. They had a nice area outside with a gas grill and firepit, which we used on several evenings. Breakfast was good and the evening reception was adequate. All of the staff I encountered were friendly and accommodating. The front desk clerk, Angie, was exceptional. She anticipated needs and always went the second mile. Angie gave friendly, attentive, 5-star service and she is to be commended. I would recommend this hotel to friends and family and plan to stay there the next time I visit Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Branson”
Reviews.Author: Dfullman
Reviews.Content: A friend gave us 3 nights stay in this hotel utilizing their Marriot points they had earned. We booked a 1 bedroom suite and were very pleased with our stay. The room was clean and well furnished. There was a nice sitting area with a tv and couch & chair along with a small table an a kitchenet. Large vanity area to spread out all your toileteries and nice tub with shower. Hotel offered a nice hot breakfast daily along with and evening snack.

Reviews.Title: “Good place”
Reviews.Author: Nelliesmom
Reviews.Content: We went to Branson for my grandmother's 80th birthday. I bid on three rooms for me and my husband, and my siblings with their spouses. We only stayed for one night but it was a good stay. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “NOT GOOD”
Reviews.Author: dawnkid
Reviews.Content: We got this 3 star hotel on Price Line with a bid of $63 for a Sunday night. The regular rate for a walk-in customer is $149. The clerk was friendly and got me hooked up with my room. The bed was extremely small so I ended up on the couch, but I have been there before like most of you other guys! Our room had a micro wave, a full size refrigerator, a range with hood, and a dish washer as well as silver ware, plates, and glasses. The tv was nice and had lots of channels. The water in the pool was cold, but the hot tub was nice. The free breakfast was ok and saved us about $14 that we would have spent at a local cafe. Everything was still ok, including the thin walls that let you hear everything in the hall and the rooms around you, and even the dirty hallways were ok until my wife saw the roach under the bathroom sink when she opened the door to get to the trash can. End of story. We won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Just like home...”
Reviews.Author: buddy1St_Louis_MO
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not directly on the strip but is close enough that it is convenient (although I wouldn't plan on walking to and from the hotel to any shopping or attractions). Our room was very nicely appointed and had a kitchenette with stainless steel appliances and granite countertops - very nice! However we were in a corner room off the parking lot and the lights from the parking lot were so bright that it was difficult to get the room dark enough to sleep comfortably (even with blackout curtains). The hot breakfast buffet was adequate but with so many other restaurant choices in Branson, it really wasn't a factor (we only ate there one morning of our stay). The staff were very friendly and the hotel was very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay, BUT.....”
Reviews.Author: msashane
Reviews.Content: the staff were very rude. The lady at the front desk when we checked in was not a plesant person at all. Our room was very nice and clean but it looked like it had a bad leak in the roof at one time. The ceiling was stained and had some cracks with some lowered areas. Overall nice place to stay, BUT we will not be back!

Reviews.Title: “Herd of elephants upstairs”
Reviews.Author: hscottmc
Reviews.Content: We did a lot of due diligence and knew the reviews were mixed. But as a Marriott Rewards customer, decided to stay there during our trip. Good service, although the room wasn't as clean as I expected. Spots on the carpet and the bathroom floor needed mopping. But the biggest problem was the noise. When the guests above us woke up in the early morning, it was light a herd of elephants were loose. Very thin ceilings and walls. Breakfast okay. Nice location. Maybe a top floor would have been better.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: csea51
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located right off the main strip at the beginning of the strip. This made it nice to go to the Landing and not have to sit in traffic. Also, very close to outlet malls and other attractions. Hotel is nice. I was traveling with a small child, but really didn't see too many other children. For 4 nights we were the only ones in the pool. Breakfast was good, the afternoon "snack" was OK. But get there early, first come first serve and when it's gone it's gone. I must say the hotel was very thoughtful. I told them when making the reservation that it was my daughter's 2nd birthday. They had a balloon and treats for her in the room upon arrival.

Reviews.Title: “New favorite place to stay in Branson”
Reviews.Author: KLash
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice now and both rooms were corner spacious suites with great rates right now. Had to work some while there and the room had everything we needed for working. Nice continental breakfast 'plus' included. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of Kids”
Reviews.Author: RedHeadedGidget
Reviews.Content: First of all, I must say that we got this room for $60 via Priceline and only stayed one night. It's very centrally located just off the 'Yellow Route' and very easy to get to places from here. Note - if you're looking for a place you can walk to the other attractions from -this isn't your place. The room was nice. We had a one-room studio and it was very open and airy. Very clean and spacious. Plenty of hot water. Parking is a little limited - don't expect to park by your room. Also, don't expect to check in prior to 3:00. We got in a little early (around 1:00) and was directed to come back after 3:00 - no exceptions. My biggest problem was that our room was next to the stairwell and therefore one of the doors to the parking lot. I was concerned about this when we arrived, but forgot about it. That was until the next morning at 6:30 when a child was locked outside of the building unable to get back in and screaming for his mother. From around 6:30 on we could hear everyone in the complex who was leaving out that door. Breakfast was good. Much better than the donuts/juice/bagels you get at most places. The ladies were also putting out food up to the 10:00 cutoff, which was welcome. Didn't get a chance to swim or enjoy the fitness area. Too many children. I would recommend staying here if I was coming to Branson for a week with my family.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice experience”
Reviews.Author: Pilot7700
Reviews.Content: Not just another Residence Inn. This property was very, very clean and modern. We booked a two-room suite and arrived early in the morning. Without hesitation, the front desk staff gave us the suite eight hours before check in time. The room was very comfortable and quiet and the hotel personnel could not have been nicer. Breakfast was plentiful and cooked very well. It was worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: IPJSIllinois
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 4 nights starting September 9th. It was a last minute decison to visit Branson and had no problem getting a room. We paid $107 AAA rate for what is called a queen studio. The room had a living area, full kitchen, table chairs and bathroom vanity was separate from the toliet and shower. The room was neat and clean and well kept up. My only complaint would be the pillows which to me were like sandbags. But then again maybe somebody else would like pillows like that. Breakfast was very good with eggs, sausage patties, pancakes or french toast, waffles, cereals, oatmeal breads fruit etc. On Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursday they have a happy hour, not with booze but with food. One afternoon it was cheese, salami, veggies and dip, brownies, rice krispie treats. Another day was nachos, chips, popcorn. The best was when they served hotdogs with beans, mac salad and coleslaw, chips, watermelon slices and dessert. We didn't go out ot dinner atter that. There were always pitchers of lemonade and iced tea. The food area was always neat and clean. On the fridge in the room was a calendar telling you what food was being served at happy hour. Seating area had about 30 or so chairs. There was also a tv in the food area so that we could watch the news. Check in was so fast. The girl only wanted to see my credit card, no liscense, nothing. The hotel does lets pets stay there as we saw a door that had a magnet on it that said pet. The pool is small and that is the only thing that I saw that could up been fixed up as to me it looked a little worn. OVerall it was a good stay and would definetely consider staying here again on our next trip to Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was going great until . . . . .”
Reviews.Author: w0kie
Reviews.Content: Everything was going great in our third floor room until . . . . The room fire alarm went off in the morning without cause and had to be replaced. Then late this afternoon our kitchen floor started flooding from two streaming ceiling water leaks. At the time is was raining outside. Thankfully we weren't at a show when our room started flooding and were able to rescue our belongings.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Residence Inn”
Reviews.Author: maxwellhouse106
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here for a week in August. We had a one bedroom suite and paid $119.00 a night. We loved the extra space in these rooms. The rooms have been updated recently and have a great look. There is a full kitchen. The room was clean and housekeeping did a great job. They have a great breakfast in the mornings with eggs, sausage, biscuits and gravy, waffles, cereral, pastries, potatoes, and more. During the week they also offer light snacks from 5pm-7pm. The hotel is 4 stories (has basement) and indoor pool. It is located on the yellow route and a short distance to everything. We all thought it was one of our favorite hotel stays.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, all around!”
Reviews.Author: bdcampbell89
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our 4-night stay at the Residence Inn. The rooms are much nicer than Marriott's pictures online: our 2-room suite had full kitchenette, marble counter tops in kitchen & bathroom, new stainless kitchen appliances, and walls were painted in nice designer colors. Location was excellent, near center of Branson but on Yellow Route so you can avoid Branson's heavy traffic. The room was kept very clean, the maid service was great. The room was quiet, even though there was a barking small dog in room next door to us, we could not hear it through the walls, only when in the hallway. Occasionally we could hear people above us through creaking floors. Breakfast was very good, includes hot waffles, french toast, eggs, oatmeal, several cereals, yogurt, donuts. Check-in & check-out were fast. The staff was friendly. We will stay here again next time we visit Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Great suite, value, and location”
Reviews.Author: Coon_Rapids_Traveler
Reviews.Content: We had the best stay yet in Branson with a one bedroom suite. Separate bedroom, large sitting area, also dining table and full kitchen. Hotel provides a full breakfast every morning and a light meal Mon - Thurs in the evening. It's the closest you can get to a feeling of living at home unless you rent a 2 bdroom + Condo. Also, location is off the strip but close enough for quick access. Price is excellent for the valuie and sqft that you get.

Reviews.Title: “Better than ever”
Reviews.Author: Texasrangers
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th stay at this hotel in the past 6 years. They have refurbished much of the hotel since our 2005 stay. Everything was extremely clean and fresh. The front desk and breakfast staff were very friendly and helpful---even the GM taste testing the BBQ meatballs before serving the evening snacks. The evening snacks and breakfasts were significantly better than most and very well maintained. The room was well kept during our stay. The pool and hot tub tempertures were set perfectly and were always very clean and stocked with towels. I don't think we could have found a better hotel or room in Branson. Look forward to staying there again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Residence Inn--Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: loimln
Reviews.Content: Very clean, quiet hotel in a great location to all attractions. Staff was very attentive and friendly. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Delighted by the personal touch!”
Reviews.Author: Katies_Grammy
Reviews.Content: Birthday cake in refrigerator - how did they know?? A real surprise for our granddaughter! During the course of booking, we must have mentioned we were traveling to celebrate her birthday, because, much to her (and our) surprise, in the refrigerator was a cake for her!! Little extras like this delighted us during our stay. Staff was friendly, attentive and clearly 'bloomed where they are planted'. Suite was clean. Breakfast buffet was good. Afternoon snacks and even warm cookies at bedtime. Located on a route that is close to everything but by-passes the major traffic. We will stay there again...most definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: TexasLuvToTravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Studio Suite. We looked on the website trying to decide if the bedroom was separate. Turns out it was not, but the room was large and very clean. The service was outstanding. We don't really like for someone to clean our room and asked that they not - but we put our trash and our used towels out by the door each day . They quickly provided clean towels and emptied the trash. The breakfast (eggs, pancakes, hashbrowns, biscuits, gravy, and much more) was yummy. The staff at the desk was very friendly. The indoor pool was nice and very well kept - and the pool hours were long (7AM to 10PM). This is a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: drewgarrett
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there for 2 nights in June 2007. The whole hotel has been remodeled since last year when we stayed there. It was very nicely done. The staff was friendly as always- they even remembered us from last year! We paid $129/night, which includes a full hot breakfast- biscuits and gravy, waffles, oatmeal, sausage, scrambled eggs, cereal, coffee, juices and all the dressings. It was a decent breakfast. The indoor heated swimming pool was a little small. It felt crowded with 6 people in it. There's also a hot tub. It was all still very nice! The rooms have a living room with couch and love seat, full kitchen w/ table, and a separate bedroom with full bath. Both the living room and bedroom had large TVs in them. The location is great, about 1/4mi off the strip. It's on the hillside, not near the neon and noise. It's overlooking the golf course. Overall, I'd say it was a very pleasant trip, and we will most likely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Branson is great”
Reviews.Author: crazy burgers
Reviews.Content: My wife and I vacationed in Branson during the middle of September, 2006. We stayed at the Residence Inn. The place was nice. Delux Breakfast every morning and late afternoon early evening they had a light meal Monday thru Thursday. The only complaint we had was the swimming pool. The water was cold--about 55 degrees. We complained to the maintenance men, and they said the water was 83 degrees and 103 in the hot tub. After complaining to the manager the next day, the temperature was raised the following day. Unfortunately both my wife and I got sick from the cold pool and could not use the pool facilities when the temperature was corrected, and even though we went to shows, we could not enjoy ourselved entirely because of being sick. The shows are great, clean and funny. We did the dinner train on Saturday and had a great time. We shared a table with a very nice couple from Texas. They were RVing, possibly my next vacation. This was the highlight of our visit. The entire train ride and meal were excellent. On Sunday we did the show boat on Table Rock Lake. The dinner again was excellent, the show great and the paddle wheel boat on the lake calming and scenic. They also have a new shopping area on the river front in down town Branson. Beautiful, especially at night with the changing lights and friendly people. Shows, great meals, nice clean place to stay, and people friendly enough to just sit and talk to, what a difference from the Northeast. We will be back, but next time I think we will stay somewhere else. Bob and Pat, Phillipsburg, New Jersey.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Rewards Members & we would NOT stay here again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stay at Marriotts a lot and were very disappointed with our stay here. The entire 3rd floor smelled like smoke even though it was nonsmoking. The rooms are very dated and old looking. If I had to speculate, I would say that the rooms have not been updated since the 80's. They were however clean, except the mold hanging from the vent in the bathroom! The kids were disappointed they could not hook up Gamecube or DVD to t.v. because it was so old it did not have the imputs for newer devices! We were looking forward to using the hotel pool, but when the kids seen how small it was, they did not want to use it. I am not kidding, it was the smallest pool I have ever seen. It was the size of the "kiddie" pool at most places. The mattresses left me very sore. The kids complained that they could feel the springs in the sofa bed. We travel a lot and this was the worst hotel we have stayed at in years. If you don't travel much and you just need a place to drop your things and won't be spending much time there, you should be fine, but there are much nicer hotels at cheaper rates if you shop around.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of fun in Branson”
Reviews.Author: jolily
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed the weekend in Branson and stayed at the Residence Inn. It is a very nice hotel located in a quiet area just behind the Grand Palace and close to many shows, restaurants and shops. It is very clean and with a separate kitchen and living room, queen size bedroom and large bath it was well worth the price of a regular hotel room. Plus a full deluxe breakfast. We enjoyed the 50's at the Hop show and the performers were excellent. The only down side was that many of the shops and shows were not open until after the 3rd of March, but we did enjoy our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Clean and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: ronip
Reviews.Content: Residence Inn is located convenient to the 76-Strip and many shows and restaurants. Staff was friendly and helpful. The room was large and clean with a fully stocked kitchen. The sofa bed, however, is not very comfortable, but was okay for our daughter. A DVD player is available for no charge. Pets are allowed for a $75 fee. A hot breakfast is included and was well prepared. The pool is indoors, but rather small. Nice alternative to small hotel room and price was competitive.

Reviews.Title: “Pleased with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rooks
Reviews.Content: We were generally very pleased with the Residence Inn Branson. The room was very, very clean. We had a one bedroom suite which slept four comfortably. While not enormous, the combination kitchen/living room was big enough for us to move about and relax. My husband and I were traveling with our children (ages 6 and 2). They were able to play and move around without too many problems. There was a TV in the living room and the bedroom and the bathroom was pretty big. The kitchen came completely equipped with everything necessary to prepare your own meals and also had a microwave and dishwasher. They provide a complete buffet breakfast each morning, which was good, but did not vary much from day to day. They also provide some food in the evening on weekdays, which we didn't sample. The night that we were there, they had a baked potato bar available. We used the pool, which was small but was empty at times so we were able to have it all to ourselves. They also have a jacuzzi. This hotel is close to the busiest street in Branson, but it proved to be a great location for us, because we were able to get to most places very quickly. The staff was very helpful and friendly throughout our stay.

HotelInfo.Name: Residence Inn Branson
HotelInfo.Address: 280 Wildwood Drive South, Branson, MO 65616
